explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although it is classified into the class 6.1 in UNRTDG, there is also information that it corrodes various metals under the presence of moisture content. (HSDB (2005))

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on rat LD50 values: 510mg/kg, 926mg/kg, 651mg/kg, and 315mg/kg (EHC 120, 1991), 505mg/kg and 530mg/kg (IRIS, 2001), 584mg/kg and 471mg/kg (ATSDR, 1999). Since the calculated values was 459mg/kg, it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: If the lower value is adopted based on rabbit LD50 value: 780mg/kg and <200mg/kg (EHC 120, 1991), Category was not able to be specificked. So it was determined that it cannot be classified.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat LC50 (4 hours) value: 0.0181mg/L (EHC 120, 1991, IRIS, 2001, ATSDR, 1999), vapor pressure of 0.0181mg/L (1.6 ppm) was judged to be steam with almost no mist. It was classified as Category 1 by the ppm concentration standard.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 from descriptions that moderate to severe irritation were observed in rabbit skin application test (EHC 120 (1991)) and skin irritation on humans was observed with exposure (IRIS (2001), and ATSDR (1999)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2A from description that severe irritation was admitted in the test applied to the eye of the rabbit of EHC 120 (1991) and ATSDR (1999).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data Skin sensitization: Based on the description that in a skin sensitivity test using the guinea pigs of EHC 120 (1991) the positive rate was 100% and it was conclude to be a skin sensitizing substance, it was referred to as Category 1.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It gave the negative results by the dominant lethality test using the mouse, which was an in vivo over generation mutagenicity test using the germ cells (EHC 120, 1991, ATSDR, 1999, NTP TR437, 1994), and it gave the negative results (IRIS, 2001, ATSDR, 1999, NTP DB, 2005) by the micronucleus test using the mouse erythrocytes, which were the in vivo mutagenicity tests using the somatic cells. So we classified it as Out Of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It was classified into E in 1986 and classified into NL (all are IRIS and 2001) according to ACGIH by A4 (ACGIH 7th, 2001) and EPA in 1996. So it carried out the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on description of no serious reproductive toxicity in maternal rabbit oral administration during pregnancy at dose of occuring general toxicity to maternal animals, and of no general toxicity and reproductive toxicity in oral administration to pregnant rat and mouce (EHC 120 (1991), IRIS (2001), NTP TR437 (1994)), it is considered as on the outside of Categry.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (respiratory organs); May cause damage to organs (liver, kidneys)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: According to the descriptions that severe respiratory irritation was identified in the human evidence of exposure (EHC 120 (1991), IRIS (2001), ACGIH (7th, 2001), NTP TR437 (1994), ATSDR (1999)), and that the influence such as pulmonary edemas etc. on the respiratory tracts was identified within the guidance value range of Category 1 in the inhalation exposure test using the rat (IRIS (2001) and ATSDR (1999)). So it was set as Category 1 (respiratory tracts). Moreover, it was set as Category 2 (liver, kidney) based on the description that the effects on the liver and kidney were identified with the given dose of guidance value range of Category 2 in the oral medication test using rats and rabbits (ATSDR (1999)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure; May cause damage to organs (kidneys) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to as Category 1 (respiratory organs) and 2 (renal) according to the description that the effects on the respiratory tract were acknowledged by the concentration of the guidance value range of Cattegory 1 in the 13-week inhalation exposure test using rats and mise of EHC 120 (1991), NTP TR437 (1994), IRIS (2001), ATSDR (1999), and the description that the effects on kidney were acknowledged with the given dose of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the oral study using rats and mise.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.007mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (EHC120, 1991).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=5.04 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
